android.view.inputmethod
Class DefaultInputMethod

java.lang.Object
  android.view.inputmethod.DefaultInputMethod
All Implemented Interfaces:
InputMethod, InputMethodSession
public class DefaultInputMethod
extends Object
implements InputMethod, InputMethodSession

This is the default input method that runs in the same context of the application that requests text input. It does nothing but returns false for any key events, so that all key events will be processed by the key listener of the focused text box.

bindInput

public void bindInput(InputBinding binding)
Description copied from interface: InputMethod
Bind a new application environment in to the input method, so that it can later start and stop input processing. Typically this method is called when this input method is enabled in an application for the first time.

Specified by:
bindInput in interface InputMethod
Parameters:
binding - Information about the application window that is binding to the input method.
See Also:
InputBinding, InputMethod.unbindInput()

unbindInput

public void unbindInput()
Description copied from interface: InputMethod
Unbind an application environment, called when the information previously set by InputMethod.bindInput(android.view.inputmethod.InputBinding) is no longer valid for this input method.

Typically this method is called when the application changes to be non-foreground.

Specified by:
unbindInput in interface InputMethod

createSession

public void createSession(InputMethod.SessionCallback callback)
Description copied from interface: InputMethod
Create a new InputMethodSession that can be handed to client applications for interacting with the input method. You can later use InputMethod.revokeSession(InputMethodSession) to destroy the session so that it can no longer be used by any clients.

Specified by:
createSession in interface InputMethod
Parameters:
callback - Interface that is called with the newly created session.

setSessionEnabled in interface InputMethod
Parameters:

revokeSession

public void revokeSession(InputMethodSession session)
Description copied from interface: InputMethod
Disable and destroy a session that was previously created with InputMethod.createSession(android.view.inputmethod.InputMethod.SessionCallback). After this call, the given session interface is no longer active and calls on it will fail.

Specified by:
revokeSession in interface InputMethod
Parameters:
session - The InputMethodSession previously provided through SessionCallback.sessionCreated() that is to be revoked.

displayCompletions

public void displayCompletions(CompletionInfo[] completions)
Description copied from interface: InputMethodSession
Called by a text editor that performs auto completion, to tell the input method about the completions it has available. This can be used by the input method to display them to the user to select the text to be inserted.

Specified by:
displayCompletions in interface InputMethodSession
Parameters:
completions - Array of text completions that are available, starting with the best. If this array is null, any existing completions will be removed.

updateExtractedText

public void updateExtractedText(int token,
                                ExtractedText text)
Description copied from interface: InputMethodSession
Called by a text editor to report its new extracted text when its contents change. This will only be called if the input method calls InputConnection.getExtractedText() with the option to report updates.

Specified by:
updateExtractedText in interface InputMethodSession
Parameters:
token - The input method supplied token for identifying its request.
text - The new extracted text.

updateSelection

public void updateSelection(int oldSelStart,
                            int oldSelEnd,
                            int newSelStart,
                            int newSelEnd,
                            int candidatesStart,
                            int candidatesEnd)
Description copied from interface: InputMethodSession
This method is called when the selection or cursor in the current target input field has changed.

Specified by:
updateSelection in interface InputMethodSession
Parameters:
oldSelStart - The previous text offset of the cursor selection start position.
oldSelEnd - The previous text offset of the cursor selection end position.
newSelStart - The new text offset of the cursor selection start position.
newSelEnd - The new text offset of the cursor selection end position.
candidatesStart - The text offset of the current candidate text start position.
candidatesEnd - The text offset of the current candidate text end position.

updateCursor

public void updateCursor(Rect newCursor)
Description copied from interface: InputMethodSession
This method is called when cursor location of the target input field has changed within its window. This is not normally called, but will only be reported if requested by the input method.

Specified by:
updateCursor in interface InputMethodSession
Parameters:
newCursor - The rectangle of the cursor currently being shown in the input field's window coordinates.

dispatchKeyEvent

public void dispatchKeyEvent(int seq,
                             KeyEvent event,
                             InputMethodSession.EventCallback callback)
Description copied from interface: InputMethodSession
This method is called when a key is pressed. When done with the event, the implementation must call back on callback with its result.

If the input method wants to handle this event, return true, otherwise return false and the caller (i.e. the application) will handle the event.

Specified by:
dispatchKeyEvent in interface InputMethodSession
event - The key event.
See Also:
#dispatchKeyUp, KeyEvent

dispatchTrackballEvent

                                   MotionEvent event,
                                   InputMethodSession.EventCallback callback)
Description copied from interface: InputMethodSession
This method is called when there is a track ball event.

If the input method wants to handle this event, return true, otherwise return false and the caller (i.e. the application) will handle the event.

Specified by:
dispatchTrackballEvent in interface InputMethodSession
event - The motion event.
See Also:
MotionEvent

restartInput

public void restartInput(EditorInfo attribute)
Description copied from interface: InputMethod
This method is called when the state of this input method needs to be reset.

Typically, this method is called when the input focus is moved from one text box to another.

Specified by:
restartInput in interface InputMethod
Parameters:
attribute - The attribute of the text box (typically, a EditText) that requests input.
See Also:
EditorInfo

attachToken

public void attachToken(IBinder token)
Description copied from interface: InputMethod
Called first thing after an input method is created, this supplies a unique token for the session it has with the system service. It is needed to identify itself with the service to validate its operations. This token must not be passed to applications, since it grants special priviledges that should not be given to applications.

Note: to protect yourself from malicious clients, you should only accept the first token given to you. Any after that may come from the client.

Specified by:
attachToken in interface InputMethod

Specified by:
startInput in interface InputMethod
Parameters:
attribute - The attribute of the text box (typically, a EditText) that requests input.
See Also:

appPrivateCommand

public void appPrivateCommand(String action,
                              Bundle data)
Description copied from interface: InputMethodSession
Process a private command sent from the application to the input method. This can be used to provide domain-specific features that are only known between certain input methods and their clients.

Specified by:
appPrivateCommand in interface InputMethodSession
Parameters:
action - Name of the command to be performed. This must be a scoped name, i.e. prefixed with a package name you own, so that different developers will not create conflicting commands.
data - Any data to include with the command.
